verses.verse: Know <S%H3045><s%> you the time <S%H6256><s%> when the wild <S%H3277><s%> goats <S%H3277><s%> of the rock <S%H5553><s%> bring <S%H3205><s%> forth? <S%H3205><s%> or can you mark <S%H8104><s%> when the hinds <S%H355><s%> do calve? <S%H2342><s%>
Can you number <S%H5608><s%> the months <S%H3391><s%> that they fulfill? or know <S%H3045><s%> you the time <S%H6256><s%> when they bring <S%H3205><s%> forth? <S%H3205><s%>
They bow <S%H3766><s%> themselves, they bring <S%H6398><s%> forth <S%H6398><s%> their young <S%H3206><s%> ones, they cast <S%H7971><s%> out their sorrows. <S%H2256><s%>

Their young <S%H1121><s%> ones are in good <S%H2492><s%> liking, <S%H2492><s%> they grow <S%H7235><s%> up with corn; <S%H1250><s%> they go <S%H3318><s%> forth, <S%H3318><s%> and return <S%H7725><s%> not to them.

Who <S%H4310><s%> has sent <S%H7971><s%> out the wild <S%H6501><s%> ass <S%H6501><s%> free? <S%H2670><s%> or who <S%H4310><s%> has loosed <S%H6605><s%> the bands <S%H4147><s%> of the wild <S%H6171><s%> ass? <S%H6171><s%>
Whose <S%H834><s%> house <S%H1004><s%> I have made <S%H7760><s%> the wilderness, <S%H6160><s%> and the barren <S%H4420><s%> land his dwellings. <S%H4908><s%>
He scorns <S%H7832><s%> the multitude <S%H1995><s%> of the city, <S%H7151><s%> neither <S%H3808><s%> regards <S%H8085><s%> he the crying <S%H8663><s%> of the driver. <S%H5065><s%>
The range <S%H3491><s%> of the mountains <S%H2022><s%> is his pasture, <S%H4829><s%> and he searches <S%H1875><s%> after <S%H310><s%> every <S%H3605><s%> green <S%H3387><s%> thing.
Will the unicorn <S%H7214><s%> be willing <S%H14><s%> to serve <S%H5647><s%> you, or abide <S%H3885><s%> by your crib? <S%H18><s%>
Can you bind <S%H7194><s%> the unicorn <S%H7214><s%> with his band <S%H5688><s%> in the furrow? <S%H8525><s%> or will he harrow <S%H7702><s%> the valleys <S%H6010><s%> after <S%H310><s%> you?
Will you trust <S%H982><s%> him, because <S%H3588><s%> his strength <S%H3581><s%> is great? <S%H7227><s%> or will you leave <S%H5800><s%> your labor <S%H3018><s%> to him?
Will you believe <S%H539><s%> him, that he will bring <S%H7725><s%> home <S%H7725><s%> your seed, <S%H2233><s%> and gather <S%H622><s%> it into your barn? <S%H1637><s%>
Gave you the goodly <S%H7443><s%> wings <S%H3671><s%> to the peacocks? <S%H7443><s%> or wings <S%H84><s%> and feathers <S%H2624><s%> to the ostrich? <S%H5133><s%>
Which <S%H3588><s%> leaves <S%H5800><s%> her eggs <S%H1000><s%> in the earth, <S%H776><s%> and warms <S%H2552><s%> them in dust, <S%H6083><s%>
And forgets <S%H7911><s%> that the foot <S%H7272><s%> may crush <S%H2115><s%> them, or that the wild <S%H7704><s%> beast <S%H2416><s%> may break <S%H1758><s%> them.
She is hardened <S%H7188><s%> against her young <S%H1121><s%> ones, as though they were not her's: her labor <S%H3018><s%> is in vain <S%H7385><s%> without <S%H1097><s%> fear; <S%H6343><s%>
Because <S%H3588><s%> God <S%H433><s%> has deprived <S%H5382><s%> her of wisdom, <S%H2451><s%> neither <S%H3808><s%> has he imparted <S%H2505><s%> to her understanding. <S%H998><s%>
What time <S%H6256><s%> she lifts <S%H4754><s%> up herself on high, <S%H4791><s%> she scorns <S%H7832><s%> the horse <S%H5483><s%> and his rider. <S%H7392><s%>
Have you given <S%H5414><s%> the horse <S%H5483><s%> strength? <S%H1369><s%> have you clothed <S%H3847><s%> his neck <S%H6677><s%> with thunder? <S%H7483><s%>
Can you make him afraid <S%H7493><s%> as a grasshopper? <S%H697><s%> the glory <S%H1935><s%> of his nostrils <S%H5170><s%> is terrible. <S%H367><s%>
He paws <S%H2658><s%> in the valley, <S%H6010><s%> and rejoices <S%H7797><s%> in his strength: <S%H3581><s%> he goes <S%H3318><s%> on to meet <S%H7125><s%> the armed <S%H5402><s%> men.
He mocks <S%H7832><s%> at fear, <S%H6343><s%> and is not affrighted; <S%H2865><s%> neither <S%H3808><s%> turns <S%H7725><s%> he back <S%H7725><s%> from the sword. <S%H2719><s%>
The quiver <S%H827><s%> rattles <S%H7439><s%> against <S%H5921><s%> him, the glittering <S%H3851><s%> spear <S%H2595><s%> and the shield. <S%H3591><s%>

He swallows <S%H1572><s%> the ground <S%H776><s%> with fierceness <S%H7494><s%> and rage: <S%H7267><s%> neither <S%H3808><s%> believes <S%H539><s%> he that it is the sound <S%H6963><s%> of the trumpet. <S%H7782><s%>

He said <S%H559><s%> among <S%H1767><s%> the trumpets, <S%H7782><s%> Ha, <S%H1889><s%> ha; <S%H1889><s%> and he smells <S%H7306><s%> the battle <S%H4421><s%> afar <S%H7350><s%> off, the thunder <S%H7482><s%> of the captains, <S%H8269><s%> and the shouting. <S%H8643><s%>
Does the hawk <S%H5322><s%> fly <S%H82><s%> by your wisdom, <S%H998><s%> and stretch <S%H6566><s%> her wings <S%H3671><s%> toward the south? <S%H8486><s%>
Does the eagle <S%H5404><s%> mount <S%H1361><s%> up at <S%H5921><s%> your command, <S%H6310><s%> and make her nest <S%H7064><s%> on high? <S%H7311><s%>
She dwells <S%H7931><s%> and stays <S%H3885><s%> on the rock, <S%H5553><s%> on the crag <S%H8127><s%> of the rock, <S%H5553><s%> and the strong <S%H4686><s%> place.
From there <S%H8033><s%> she seeks <S%H2658><s%> the prey, <S%H400><s%> and her eyes <S%H5869><s%> behold <S%H5027><s%> afar <S%H7350><s%> off.
Her young <S%H667><s%> ones also suck <S%H5966><s%> up blood: <S%H1818><s%> and where <S%H834><s%> the slain <S%H2491><s%> are, there <S%H8033><s%> is she.
